dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Hi Sam! Did you see the new recycling bins near the school?

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Yes, I did! They put them there yesterday. We ought to recycle glass and paper.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: That's good. My mum recycles everything at home. She used my pen to write a list of what we can recycle.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: That's helpful! Do you want to help with the school recycling club tomorrow?

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Early in the morning. We can set up the bins and show everyone how to use them.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: I'm here! Where is everyone? I expected to see a lot of members from the club.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: I don't know. Nobody is here. This is trouble.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Did you expect that? We have so much to do.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: No, I didn't. We have glass bottles, paper, and clothes to sort. It's too much for just us.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: I'm a bit tired already. What can we do?

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: We can press the doorbell at the building near here. Maybe someone will help us.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Look! Three people are here now. They want to help!

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: That's good! You can put the glass bottles in this bin. We recycle them.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: And the paper goes in that bin over there. Obviously, we can't put clothes with glass.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: The result is really good. We filled all the bins!

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Yes! This will help our school and society.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: I'm tired, but happy. Good work today!
